description: An ancient city on the island of Jaya, home to the Shandia tribe 400 years ago. Known as the 'City of Gold,' Shandora is famous for its Golden Bell and golden architecture. The city was later blasted up to Skypiea by the Knock Up Stream.

keyEvents.title: Introduction of Shandora
keyEvents.description: The flashback reveals Shandora as a thriving Shandia village 400 years ago, home to Kalgara and his people.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the ancient city that becomes central to the Skypiea arc's history.

keyEvents.title: Tree Fever Plague
keyEvents.description: Shandora is devastated by Tree Fever, a deadly plague with a 90% fatality rate that forces the Shandia to consider human sacrifice.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the crisis that brings Mont Blanc Noland to Shandora.

keyEvents.title: Noland Promises to Cure the Village
keyEvents.description: Mont Blanc Noland promises to cure Shandora's plague by sunset, offering hope to the desperate Shandia people.
keyEvents.significance: Begins the relationship between Noland and the Shandia that will define Shandora's history.

culturalSignificance: Shandora is the ancestral home of the Shandia people and houses the Golden Bell, which becomes a symbol of friendship and promise. The city's rich golden architecture earned it the name 'City of Gold,' inspiring legends that would persist for centuries.

description: A sacred altar in Shandora where the Shandia tribe performed religious sacrifices to their snake god Kashigami. The altar is located in water and can be reached by boat or swimming. It became the site of the crucial confrontation between Mont Blanc Noland and Kalgara.

keyEvents.title: Mousse Brought to Sacrificial Altar
keyEvents.description: Mousse is brought by boat to the Sacrificial Altar to be offered to Kashigami in hopes of curing the village's plague.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the desperation of the Shandia people and their willingness to sacrifice their own to save the village.

keyEvents.title: Kashigami Appears at the Altar
keyEvents.description: The giant snake god Kashigami emerges from the water at the altar to receive the sacrifice of Mousse.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the reality of the Shandia's religious beliefs.

keyEvents.title: Noland Kills Kashigami at the Altar
keyEvents.description: Mont Blanc Noland jumps onto the Sacrificial Altar and beheads Kashigami, saving Mousse but horrifying the Shandia people.
keyEvents.significance: The pivotal moment that creates conflict between Noland and the Shandia, setting up their eventual friendship.

keyEvents.title: Kalgara Attacks Noland at the Altar
keyEvents.description: Kalgara swims to the altar and attacks Noland for killing their god and disrupting the sacred ritual.
keyEvents.significance: The first confrontation between Noland and Kalgara at the very site where Noland saved Mousse's life.

statusHistory.description: Used for religious sacrifices to Kashigami

culturalSignificance: The Sacrificial Altar was the most sacred religious site for the ancient Shandia, where they would offer sacrifices to their snake god Kashigami. The altar became the site of a crucial turning point in Shandia history when Noland killed Kashigami and saved Mousse.
notableFeatures: Surrounded by water requiring boat access

description: An island in the Grand Line, originally much larger before half of it was blasted into the sky by the Knock Up Stream 400 years ago. The flashback shows Jaya in its complete form, home to the Shandia tribe and the golden city of Shandora.

geographicDetails.terrain: Dense forests, beaches, and ancient ruins

keyEvents.title: Kalgara Defends Jaya
keyEvents.description: The flashback shows Kalgara defending Jaya from intruders 400 years ago, earning his reputation as the 'Demon of Shandora.'
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Jaya's status as the homeland of the Shandia people in the past.

keyEvents.title: Noland Arrives at Jaya
keyEvents.description: Mont Blanc Noland's ship arrives at Jaya, guided by the sound of the Golden Bell through a storm.
keyEvents.significance: Noland's arrival at Jaya sets up the legendary friendship story.

culturalSignificance: Jaya was the original home of the Shandia tribe and the golden city of Shandora. The island's upper half, including Shandora, was later shot into the sky by a Knock Up Stream, becoming Upper Yard in Skypiea.
notableFeatures: Home to Shandora, the City of Gold
Sacred forests affected by Tree Fever
Later split by Knock Up Stream
